alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 11:55AM CDT until April 18 at 10:50PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River near Amory For the Tombigbee River...including Fulton, Bigbee, Amory, Aberdeen L & D...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Amory. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 20.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening to 18.1 feet and begin rising again tomorrow morning. It will rise above flood stage again early Monday morning and continue to rise to 21.0 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage again Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
